strategy: Use LightGBM with the following settings: num_boost_round=500, learning_rate=0.05, max_depth=7. For preprocessing: fill numeric NaN values with the median, drop columns with more than 50% missing values. Use LightGBM's categorical feature handling by passing categorical feature indices directly. If you encounter a dtype error, ensure categorical columns are cast to strings.

actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import lightgbm as lgb

# Load data
train = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
validation = pd.read_csv('data/validation.csv')
test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train.drop(['Id', 'SalePrice'], axis=1)
y_train = train['SalePrice']
X_val = validation.drop(['Id', 'SalePrice'], axis=1)
y_val = validation['SalePrice']
X_test = test.drop(['Id'], axis=1)

# Fill numeric NaN with median
numeric_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns
X_train[numeric_columns] = X_train[numeric_columns].fillna(X_train[numeric_columns].median())
X_val[numeric_columns] = X_val[numeric_columns].fillna(X_val[numeric_columns].median())
X_test[numeric_columns] = X_test[numeric_columns].fillna(X_test[numeric_columns].median())

# Handle categorical columns: convert to string and identify categorical features
categorical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns
for col in categorical_columns:
    X_train[col] = X_train[col].astype(str)
    X_val[col] = X_val[col].astype(str)
    X_test[col] = X_test[col].astype(str)

# Identify categorical feature indices (LightGBM handles them natively)
categorical_features = list(categorical_columns)

# Define LightGBM model
model = lgb.LGBMRegressor(
    num_boost_round=500,
    learning_rate=0.05,
    max_depth=7,
    random_state=42,
    n_jobs=-1
)

# Train model
model.fit(X_train, y_train, eval_set=[(X_val, y_val)], early_stopping_rounds=20, verbose=100)

# Predict on test set
y_test_pred = model.predict(X_test)

# Create submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'Id': test['Id'],
    'SalePrice': y_test_pred
})

# Save submission
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import lightgbm as lgb

# Load data
train = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
validation = pd.read_csv('data/validation.csv')
test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train.drop(['Id', 'SalePrice'], axis=1)
y_train = train['SalePrice']
X_val = validation.drop(['Id', 'SalePrice'], axis=1)
y_val = validation['SalePrice']
X_test = test.drop(['Id'], axis=1)

# Fill numeric NaN with median
numeric_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns
X_train[numeric_columns] = X_train[numeric_columns].fillna(X_train[numeric_columns].median())
X_val[numeric_columns] = X_val[numeric_columns].fillna(X_val[numeric_columns].median())

    X_test[col] = X_test[col].astype(str)

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import lightgbm as lgb

# Load data
train = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
validation = pd.read_csv('data/validation.csv')
test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train.drop(['Id', 'SalePrice'], axis=1)
y_train = train['SalePrice']
X_val = validation.drop(['Id', 'SalePrice'], axis=1)
y_val = validation['SalePrice']
X_test = test.drop(['Id'], axis=1)

# Fill numeric NaN with median
numeric_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns
X_train[numeric_columns] = X_train[numeric_columns].fillna(X_train[numeric_columns].median())
X_val[numeric_columns] = X_val[numeric_columns].fillna(X_val[numeric_columns].median())
X_test[numeric_columns] = X_test[numeric_columns].fillna(X_test[numeric_columns].median())

# Convert all categorical columns to string (required for LightGBM)
categorical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns
for col in categorical_columns:
    X_train[col] = X_train[col].astype(str)
    X_val[col] = X_val[col].astype(str)
    X_test[col] = X_test[col].astype(str)

# Define LightGBM model with categorical feature handling
model = lgb.LGBMRegressor(
    num_boost_round=500,
    learning_rate=0.05,
    max_depth=7,
    random_state=42,
    n_jobs=-1
)

# Train model

# Predict on test set

# Create submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'Id': test['Id'],
    'SalePrice': y_test_pred
})

# Save submission
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import lightgbm as lgb

# Load data
train = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
validation = pd.read_csv('data/validation.csv')
test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train.drop(['Id', 'SalePrice'], axis=1)
y_train = train['SalePrice']
X_val = validation.drop(['Id', 'SalePrice'], axis=1)
y_val = validation['SalePrice']
X_test = test.drop(['Id'], axis=1)

# Fill numeric NaN with median
numeric_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns
X_train[numeric_columns] = X_train[numeric_columns].fillna(X_train[numeric_columns].median())
X_val[numeric_columns] = X_val[numeric_columns].fillna(X_val[numeric_columns].median())
X_test[numeric_columns] = X_test[numeric_columns].fillna(X_test[numeric_columns].median())

# Convert all categorical columns to string
categorical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns
for col in categorical_columns:
    X_train[col] = X_train[col].astype(str)
    X_val[col] = X_val[col].astype(str)
    X_test[col] = X_test[col].astype(str)

# Define LightGBM model
model = lgb.LGBMRegressor(
    num_boost_round=500,
    learning_rate=0.05,
    max_depth=7,
    random_state=42,
    n_jobs=-1
)

# Train model
model.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Predict on test set
y_test_pred = model.predict(X_test)

# Create submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'Id': test['Id'],
    'SalePrice': y_test_pred
})

# Save submission
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import lightgbm as lgb

# Load data
train = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train.drop(['Id', 'SalePrice'], axis=1)
y_train = train['SalePrice']
X_test = test.drop(['Id'], axis=1)

# Fill numeric NaN with median
numeric_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns
X_train[numeric_columns] = X_train[numeric_columns].fillna(X_train[numeric_columns].median())
X_test[numeric_columns] = X_test[numeric_columns].fillna(X_test[numeric_columns].median())

# Convert all categorical columns to string
categorical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns
for col in categorical_columns:
    X_train[col] = X_train[col].astype(str)
    X_test[col] = X_test[col].astype(str)

# Define LightGBM model
model = lgb.LGBMRegressor(
    num_boost_round=500,
    learning_rate=0.05,
    max_depth=7,
    random_state=42,
    n_jobs=-1
)

# Train model
model.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Predict on test set
y_test_pred = model.predict(X_test)

# Create submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'Id': test['Id'],
    'SalePrice': y_test_pred
})

# Save submission
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
